name: Sodium bicarbonate
desc: Sodium bicarbonate (IUPAC name: sodium hydrogen carbonate) is a chemical compound with the formula NaHCO3. It is a salt composed of sodium ions and bicarbonate ions. Sodium bicarbonate is a white solid that is crystalline but often appears as a fine powder. It has a slightly salty, alkaline taste resembling that of washing soda (sodium carbonate). The natural mineral form is nahcolite. It is a component of the mineral natron and is found dissolved in many mineral springs. It is among the food additives encoded by the European Union, identified as E 500.

images.alt: Ball and stick model of a sodium cation

nahcolite: Baking soda, bicarb (laboratory slang), bicarbonate of soda, nahcolite
Density:
• 2.20 g/cm3 as solid[1]
  • 1.1 to 1.3 as powder[2]
Solubility: 0.02 wt% acetone, 2.13 wt% methanol @22 °C.[5] insoluble in ethanol
